Kazbegi Skyrunning Camp

Comfort Version

Join an extraordinary week of high-altitude running in the Caucasus mountains of Georgia — a skyrunner's dream through untamed trails, ancient culture, and breathtaking views.

Camp Dates

Sept 25 - Oct 2, 2025 (6 spots left)

Price: 2850 EUR

All-Inclusive. A 25% deposit secures your spot. Balance due 60 days before start.

Request to Book

Kazbegi Skyrunning Camp Overview

Welcome to Kazbegi, a hidden gem nestled in the Greater Caucasus. Picture rugged alpine ridges, sweeping valleys, glaciers, and remote trails winding through centuries-old villages. This 7-day skyrunning camp offers an epic blend of endurance, adventure, and exploration.

This adventure includes nearly 100 miles (160 km) of trail running with over 9,800 meters (32,000 ft) of elevation gain. It's challenging, beautiful, and unlike anything else in Europe. Starting and ending in Tbilisi, we'll base ourselves in Stepantsminda (Kazbegi), Georgia — gateway to Mount Kazbek (5,047m).

Why Travel With Us

We are a small, family-run team who specialize in crafting unique running experiences that balance raw wilderness with comfort. Every detail is handled with care to ensure a meaningful and memorable journey — because this is your dream, your effort, and your time.

Who Is This For?

If you're a trail runner or road runner seeking the next level of adventure, this camp is for you. You don't need to be a racer — just in good shape and ready to run for 6–8 hours daily with substantial elevation gain.

Fitness Requirements

This is a high-effort trip with daily outings of 6–8 hours and elevation gains of up to 1500m. You should be in excellent hiking/running condition and capable of mountain terrain. Not sure? Let's chat.

Daily Itinerary

Day 1 | Kazbegi Arrival & Acclimatization

Transfer from Tbilisi to Kazbegi (Stepantsminda), a scenic 3–4 hour drive along the legendary Georgian Military Highway. Upon arrival, you'll settle into our cozy guesthouse or hotel nestled in the heart of the mountains, with views of the iconic Mount Kazbek. Depending on arrival time, we'll take a gentle acclimatization hike to the Gergeti Trinity Church (2170 m), perched above the village with jaw-dropping views of the Kazbegi massif. In the evening, we'll hold a safety briefing and overview of the week ahead.

Accommodation: Rooms Hotel Kazbegi, or a cozy local guesthouse, twin or double occupancy.

Day 2 | Khde Gorge & Truso Valley

We begin with a technical warm-up trail through Khde Gorge, one of the region's wildest and least-traveled canyons, with cascading waterfalls and steep, rugged terrain. Later, we transfer to Truso Valley—an otherworldly plateau flanked by colorful mineral springs, ancient ruins, and abandoned Ossetian villages. Optional dip in natural mineral springs to relax the legs.

The route: ~15km / 9.3mi | Elevation gain/loss: +800m | -800m | Approximate time: 4–5 hours | Accommodation: Return to Kazbegi lodging

Day 3 | Juta & Chaukhi Pass

After breakfast, we head to the alpine village of Juta (2200 m) and begin a breathtaking ascent to the Chaukhi Pass (3338 m). This route, often called the "Georgian Dolomites," is a favorite among skyrunners. Expect a mix of rocky climbs, fast descents, and panoramic ridgelines. We descend toward the Abudelauri Lakes if weather permits, or return via the same route for a high-altitude lunch near the pass.

The route: ~18km / 11mi | Elevation gain/loss: +1100m | -1100m | Highest point: 3338m / 10,950 ft | Approximate time: 5–6 hours | Accommodation: Juta guesthouse or mountain hut (shared rooms)

Day 4 | Sno Valley Ridge Run

Today we explore the ridgeline above Sno Valley, linking traditional trails with sheep tracks and panoramic lookouts. This is a wilder, off-the-beaten-path day where you'll see few people and feel immersed in the Caucasus wilderness. Expect technical terrain and sweeping views of the Kazbegi region and Dagestan borderlands.

The route: ~17km / 10.5mi | Elevation gain/loss: +950m | -950m | Approximate time: 5–6 hours | Accommodation: Return to Kazbegi base

Day 5 | Rest Day or Optional Cultural Tour

A well-earned rest day. You can opt to relax, soak in the views from a cafe terrace, or take an optional cultural tour to the Dariali Monastery, Gveleti Waterfalls, or a cheese-making experience with local farmers. This is a great time to recharge and prep for the next set of mountain challenges.

Accommodation: Kazbegi guesthouse/hotel

Day 6 | Arsha to Gergeti Ridge Traverse

We set out from Arsha village and climb a scenic trail through forests and wild meadows to a hidden ridge above Gergeti. This traverse offers some of the best trail running and skyrunning in the region, with sustained climbs, technical ridgelines, and fast runnable descents.

We'll finish at a high alpine meadow with views of Mount Kazbek (5047 m), before making our way back to town.

The route: ~20km / 12.4mi

Elevation gain/loss: +1200m | -1200m

Approximate time: 6–7 hours

Accommodation: Final night in Kazbegi

Day 7 | Farewell & Transfer to Tbilisi

After a hearty breakfast, we pack up and transfer back to Tbilisi. We'll stop at Ananuri Fortress or Zhinvali Reservoir on the way for photos and snacks.

This marks the end of an unforgettable week in the Caucasus.
